ygData.subject: Re: some info
ygData.msgSnippet: I would take a guess - and this is only a guess - that the power mudules may be used in the making of the Thermal Cloak - or even perhaps the Gnomish
ygData.messageBody:
I would take a guess - and this is only a guess - that the power mudules
may be used in the making of the Thermal Cloak - or even perhaps the
Gnomish Environmental Suit (even though I still think this is a fake
item). I can't imagine a fishing pole needing any kind of power source,
unless the gears are "automatic" and need "batteries," but this still
sounds farfetched. I could also see the infavision goggles needing a mock
power source but again this is only a guess.

Making those bags would be quite impressive, however I imagine also very
expensive to make taking in consideration how much they vendors sell them.
Personally, I'm not convinced Verant would allow us to make such a
powerful item but it will be interesting to see. I can't wait to check
out the third book - I imagine it will be quite the eye opener.

As far as the location of the book goes, there must be some clues within
Soluesk and the mino caves (considering the author had quite a few
dealings with minos). Has anyone tried going around to each NPC and asked
"Do you know Gimble-so-and-so? (I can't remember the spelling)

As anyone experimented with the Glowing Amber Lens to see if they can make
the goggles yet? Any beta-testers on this list who knew the beta-recipe?

Quasinom de Plume

--- Big Dave <xceller@...> wrote:
> On the third book:
> I know a gnome on my server (Fennin Ro) named Renten I think, that was
> utterly obsessed with finding the third book. He said he found clues
> that led him to Permafrost where he had been searching for the past
> several days (and he was level 8 at the time). I'm convinced he is on
> to something, nobody in their right mind would risk that kind of venture
> without good reason. However, I have not heard anything from him in
> several weeks, he may have given up or lost his level many times, I
> don't know. But I'm going back there to do some more exporing myself.
>
> On Solusek's Eye:
> If you invis yourself, you can get to the gnome castle easily. I have
> run all over it, and hailed almost every gnome I have found there. The
> one vendor does have the bag of the tinkerers and I'm wondering if we
> can tinker it somehow. He also carries broken force modules, broken
> frost modules, functional frost modules, and a power module. THIS
> intrigues me! Could it be that the force and power module might be
> needed to make the bag, or maybe the collapsible fishing pole is
> powered?
> Maybe these items are needed as well as the vendor-sold gizmos and such
> in ak'anon to construct things like the Pole or the Bag, or maybe even
> things none of us players have thought of yet. The last idea seems
> reasonable to me since most the junk we know how to make and can make is
> virtually worthless to other players since they can get cheaper
> alternatives than our stuff.
>
